bug.short_desc: Add pointed notation to navigate easier through an object

long_desc.thetext:
Hi,
When you navigate through a qooxdoo object, you use these syntaxes :
obj.getA().getB().getC() or obj.get("a").get("b").get("c")
It would be cool to implements a "pointed notation" to navigate like that :
obj.get("a.b.c")
And why not, implements also for set :
obj.set("a.b.c", "value")
This kind of syntax already exists when you use addTarget method to bind model property to a object.
What is your opinion ?

The generic set / get method are part of the property API. The chaining of properties and the dot notation in the binding strings are part of the data binding API. So combining both would be a mix of both of them. Not everyone using properties needs and knows the data binding syntax. But having that with a separate API could help as well. Even though I would not know how to name that. :)
I support this feature too. Naming this feature will be much harder than implementing.
